subclassFeature.name: Aspect of War
entries: By choosing this aspect the Warpriest becomes more proficient in the front lines of the battlefield.

At 3rd level the Warpriest learns {@b Improved Sacred Weapon} increasing {@classFeature sacred weapon|warpriest|Nindale|2||its} damage by {@damage 1d6}, {@damage 2d6} at level 5, {@damage 3d6} at level 10, {@damage 4d6} at level 15 and {@damage 5d6} at level 20. It also improves it attack and damage rolls by 1, at level 10 increases this bonus by 2.

subclassFeature.name: Way of War
entries: Additionally, at 3rd level, combat runs through your veins and now you may now use your reaction to counter-attack with disadvantage if a melee attack misses you. You can use a {@classFeature Fervor|warpriest|Nindale|1} charge to counter-attack without disadvantage.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Weapon
entries: At 7th level you learn to use a {@classFeature Fervor|warpriest|Nindale|1} charge to imbue your weapon with it as a bonus action. If the next attack with that weapon hits, it takes the damage of the weapon plus the damage of {@classFeature Fervor|warpriest|Nindale|1}. If failure the creature only takes half of the {@classFeature Fervor|warpriest|Nindale|1} damage. This ability stacks with both {@classFeature Sacred Weapon|warpriest|Nindale|2} and {@subclassFeature Aspect of War|warpriest|Nindale|War|Nindale|3||Improved Sacred Weapon}.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Armor
entries: At 13th level, your AC is increased by 2 and also increases the damage from {@classFeature Sacred Armor|warpriest|Nindale|10} by 1. {@classFeature Sacred Armor|warpriest|Nindale|10||Sacred Armor's} damage is now applied also to spells that hit you as well and has no range requirements anymore.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Empowerment
entries: At 18th, level using {@subclassFeature Divine Weapon|warpriest|Nindale|War|Nindale|7} no longer consumes {@classFeature Fervor|warpriest|Nindale|1} charges. in addition, using one charge of {@classFeature Fervor|warpriest|Nindale|1} as a bonus action will imbue the weapon with {@classFeature Sacred Pulse|warpriest|Nindale|6}, if the melee attack hits {@classFeature Sacred Pulse|warpriest|Nindale|6} deals damage as if {@i all} targets failed the save roll; if the attack misses the enemies in range take half of the damage.

subclassFeature.name: Aspect of Light
entries: By choosing this aspect the Warpriest becomes more proficient in the back lines of the battlefield.

At 3rd level, the Warpriest learns {@b Charged Sacred Weapon}. This acts as a cantrip (does not affect or alters Cantrips Known and acts as an additional one). By overcharging your {@classFeature Sacred Weapon|Warpriest|Nindale|2} you are able to throw the extra energy within it. Make a ranged spell check, on a hit the target creature within 60 feet of you takes the weapon's damage and {@classFeature Sacred Weapon|Warpriest|Nindale|2} damage. After that, you can not imbue it with radiant energy until the end of the battle.

subclassFeature.name: Way of Light
entries: Additionally, at 3rd level, healing has become second nature to you and now you heal as an action without using a spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Fervor
entries: At 7th level, {@classFeature Fervor|warpriest|Nindale|1} becomes more lethal to use. If you fail the spell attack against a foe using {@classFeature Fervor|warpriest|Nindale|1} that creature takes half of the damage from the attack instead of none.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Sacred Pulse
entries: At 13th level, {@classFeature Sacred Pulse|warpriest|Nindale|6} can now be cast on a target within 30 feet of the warpriest as the center for the spell. {@classFeature Sacred Pulse|warpriest|Nindale|6} gains a second pulse on the Warpriest's next turn healing or dealing half the damage of the first pulse.

subclassFeature.name: Sacred Empowerment
entries: At 18th level, {@classFeature Fervor|warpriest|Nindale|1} gains 3 additional charges; if you spend 2 charges instead of 1, {@classFeature Fervor|warpriest|Nindale|1} automatically hits and adds an extra {@damage 3d6} to the spell's damage or heal. {@classFeature Sacred Pulse|warpriest|Nindale|6} gains an additional charge, the second pulse now deals full damage.

entries.name: Warpriest
entries: A fierce divine warrior capable of taking the front lines and is able to manipulate radiant energy with positive or negative elements.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a Warpriest quickly by following these suggestions. First, Wisdom should be your highest ability score, followed by Strength. Second, choose the {@background Folk Hero} background. Third, choose the {@spell sacred flame} cantrip; and {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Persuasion} and {@skill Survival} Skills.
